attributes.additional_details: Is there a justice system that gives the right for a person, to sue the justice system for not taking action, especially when the persons concerned are innocent, and the rulers, law makers and protectorates of Great Britain are proven as 'out of order' of committing serious offences. If so, perhaps the government could explain their policies. I am writing on behalf of myself and two others, who were victims of British army brutality, that occurred in Royal Windsor in the early 1970's, having received no justice for ourselves for the past 43 years.
